contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) that "the dead" and "spirits" are two different things or 2) that this is a doublet that means "the spirits of dead people" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These phrases mean the same thing and emphasize the command for obedience. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "keep" and "carry out" mean the same thing. They emphasize that the people must obey God's commands. AT: "obey my commandments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: keep my commandments and carry them out

contextId.information: These two phrases refer to God causing them to have many descendants so they become a large group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: make you fruitful and multiply you
